body_html: Theoretically one benefit may be more readable functional calls like map(tensor.index, [0, 1, 2]) (vs sth like map(tensor.__getitem__, [0, 1, 2])). This particular example isn't very practical, my point is that in some theoretical cases it may be useful to have a readable functional synonym for __getitem__.
body_text: Theoretically one benefit may be more readable functional calls like map(tensor.index, [0, 1, 2]) (vs sth like map(tensor.__getitem__, [0, 1, 2])). This particular example isn't very practical, my point is that in some theoretical cases it may be useful to have a readable functional synonym for __getitem__.
body: Theoretically one benefit may be more readable functional calls like `map(tensor.index, [0, 1, 2])` (vs sth like `map(tensor.__getitem__, [0, 1, 2])`). This particular example isn't very practical, my point is that in some theoretical cases it may be useful to have a readable functional synonym for `__getitem__`.
